remarks: If two sets have the same vertices and the same edges, one set is a hypergraph iff the other set is a hypergraph.  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-Dec-2017.)  (Revised by AV, 18-Jan-2020.)
statement:
uhgf.v $e |- V = ( Base ` G ) $.
uhgf.e $e |- E = ( .ef ` G ) $.
uhgeq12g.w $e |- W = ( Base ` H ) $.
uhgeq12g.f $e |- F = ( .ef ` H ) $.
uhgeq12g $p |- ( ( ( G e. X /\ H e. Y ) /\ ( V = W /\ E = F ) ) -> ( G e. UHGraph <-> H e. UHGraph ) ) $.
